arts.ttl: Exeter City back to winning ways after late winner at Barnsley
arts.sum: Ryan Trevitt’s first goal of his second spell with the Grecians put them ahead with 14 minutes on the clock, bundling the ball home from close range after two efforts were blocked. His shot was blocked, as was Watts’ follow-up, but the ball broke back to Trevitt six yards out, who tapped into the net for his first goal of the season, and was no less than what City deserved for their start.

arts.ttl: Josh Magennis hails Exeter City's togetherness after Grecians win
arts.sum: Exeter City striker Josh Magennis hailed the togetherness of the Grecians to bounce back from a disappointing weekend defeat as they won 2-1 victory over Barnsley at Oakwell. The skipper robbed Mael de Gevigney before smashing home the finish at the near post, against the run of play, to the City fans’ delight, as he netted his 12 th of the season.

arts.ttl: Exeter City announce profit as Grecians stay sustainable
arts.sum: EXETER City have announced a near £100,000 profit for the financial year ending June 2024 with chief executive Joe Gorman expressing his immense pride at running a sustainable League One football club. Acknowledging our Operational Loss has increased this year is really important, however I can assure supporters that managing this remains our priority and focuses our minds on the importance of our player development model.

arts.ttl: Josh Magennis leads by example to give Exeter victory at Barnsley
arts.sum: The hosts are winless in six matches following defeat at Oakwell.

arts.ttl: Exeter City want to start another unbeaten run and cause Barnsley problems
arts.sum: “We have analysed the game, as we always do, the players were in on Sunday recovering and we have prepared today for Barnsley, but there are always things you can take, win, lose or draw in a game where you can be better,” Caldwell said. In fact, in 11 games against the top six so far this season – Saturday’s home clash with Stockport will be their last game against the current top six - City have scored just five goals with their sole win coming against Charlton Athletic at St James Park on November 9.

arts.ttl: Barnsley pair back available for Exeter City clash amid latest selection update
arts.sum: Barnsley interim boss Conor Hourihane has said Dexter Lembikisa and Clement Rodrigues are back in ‘contention’ to play… The post Barnsley pair back available for Exeter City clash amid latest selection update appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Exeter City's defeat to Wrexham show gulf in class Grecians need to close
arts.sum: Exeter City boss Gary Caldwell felt the 2-0 defeat to promotion-chasing Wrexham showed the gulf in class that they need to close in order to compete at the top of League One. The Grecians held their own for large periods at St James Park but ultimately failed to lay a glove on the Red Dragons as their six game unbeaten run came to an end. City had the first chance of the second half from a corner which turned into a scramble, but Purrington and Colwill couldn’t connect cleanly with their efforts.

Barnsley's playoff hopes are all-but over after the draw at Wigan, their fifth straight game without victory, leaves them eight points adrift with just seven games left. The Tykes have won just once ...

arts.ttl: Preview: Barnsley vs. Exeter City - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Tuesday's League One clash between Barnsley and Exeter City, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
